p: A gas sensor based on a photonic crystal nanobeam cavity coupled to a tapered optical fibre was proposed [ 85]. The nanobeam cavity has seven pairs of tapered air holes and ten pairs of mirror holes ( Figure 16) and has a Q factor of 2.2 × 10 6. A change of the RI of the gas leads to a linear change of resonance wavelength, with a sensitivity of ca. 0.19 nm /10 − 3 RIU which could be related to the gas concentration change.
